questions.question: Sam can run ……………………. than you.
questions.description: We need a comparative expression before than.

questions.question: Raghu is …………………. than his friends.
questions.description: Cleverer is the comparative form of clever.

questions.question: You are no ……………………. than him.
questions.description: Better is the comparative form of good.

questions.question: It was …………………….. than I thought.
questions.description: Easier is the comparative form of easy.

questions.question: Lead is the ……………………… metal.
questions.description: We use the superlative to compare one thing with the whole group that it belongs to.

questions.question: A rabbit is ……………………. than a deer.
questions.description: Smaller is the comparative form of small.

questions.question: This is ……………………… than that.
questions.description: More attractive is the comparative form of attractive.

questions.question: Your voice is ………………….. than mine.
questions.description: Worse is the comparative form of bad.

questions.question: She earns ……………………. money than I do.
questions.description: Less is the comparative form of little.

questions.question: The …………………….. expensive holidays are often the best.
I was not as intelligent as the others, but I was the …………………..
questions.description: Prettiest is the superlative form of pretty.

questions.question: As you get older, you get …………………….
questions.description: In this structure we use a comparative in both clauses.
